content: I'm searching FHIR resource to store systems review for physical examination of a patient
Observations, possibly grouped by a parent Observation using 'member'.
(You could choose to capture the raw data using QuestionnaireResponse, but it wouldn't be searchable or easily comparible)
There's also ClinicalImpression - though a maturity level of 0 makes you a bit cautious...

David Hay said:

There's also ClinicalImpression - though a maturity level of 0 makes you a bit cautious...

ClinicalImpression has been in the FHIR Specification since DSTU2! Any reason why it hasn't progressed beyond FMM Level 0 @Michelle (Moseman) Miller & fellow PC co-chairs?

783 views, to date, of the related background page on Confluence. I wonder if re-naming the resource to ClinicalAssessment might help to engage more implementers? I don't agree with the notion in the spec that this would create confusion with observation results such as Apgar scores.
I think it's more a question of what there's interest in sharing/exposing than lack of awareness
Literally, [Clinical] Impression is just a section of a diagnostic imaging report （even a lab report）here.
